abstract: Germana Soares and Glecion Amorim, young Brazilian couple who harbored middle-class dreams, have seen their fortunes dashed by country's economic instability and spread of Zika virus; Amorim lost job as welder during oil industry scandal-related downturn, and couple's child was born with Zika-related birth defects; their struggle exemplifies that of millions faced with raising disabled child while living in poverty.
lead_paragraph: In the wake of the Zika epidemic, hundreds of families in northeastern Brazil are facing the prospect of raising a disabled child in poverty.

headline.main: After Living Brazil’s Dream, Family Confronts Microcephaly and Economic Crisis
headline.print_headline: Living Brazil’s Dream, Then Managing Birth Defect and Poverty
